p: The 5-chloropyridyl esters GRL-001 ( 66) and 67 ( Fig. 10 ) have been shown to block the replication of SARS- and MERS-CoV 3CL pro 112, 113 and could serve as potential leads for the future drug development for anti-coronavirus therapy. Pyrazolone based neuraminidase (NA) inhibitors 68–70 ( Fig. 10) were reported to inhibit the MERS-CoV 3CL pro with moderate potencies in the range of 5.8-7.5 μM. The pharmacophore moieties phenyl at R3 and carboxylate, either R1 or R4 were suggested to be essential for the antiviral activity [114]. A dipeptidyl transition state 3CL pro inhibitor GC376 ( 71) inhibited the activity of MERS-CoV 3CL pro with an EC 50 of 1.6 μM by fluorescence resonance energy transfer (FRET) assay [115]. Another pyrrolidinone based peptide GC813 ( 72) as well as its derivatives 73- 74 displayed inhibition for MERS-CoV with EC50 values of 0.5 μM, 0.5 μM, and 0.8 μM in cell culture [116].
